title: Ticket #5223: Better error message when job is shell script without #! header
description:
If you submit a shell script as your job, but it lacks the #! line specifying the interpreter, HTCondor will put your job on hold with a message like: 

    Error from slot8@potatoes.example.com: Failed to execute '/path/to/test/exe': (errno=8: 'Exec format error')

That's the error from exec, and while accurate, isn't helpful. Especially since the user can probably run /path/to/test/exe and have it run as their shell covers for them. We should provide a more helpful message:

Possibilities:

  • Add "If your job is a shell script, ensure the correct interpreter is specified on the #! line of your program."
  • As above, but try to be clever and sniff that it's not a binary. Perhaps first 1kB is ASCII or valid UTF-8?
